Articles.Content:
So I was browsing the mods, and I noticed that some are labelled [Part] and some are labelled [Plugin]

What is the difference?

Mods with [Part] just add parts, they don't add any code to KSP. Mods with [Plugin] add new program functions to KSP. There is some overlap, some plugin mods also add parts and some parts mods use plugins to create new functionality.

In practical terms, a "pure" parts mod is much less likely to cause any wider game bugs, beyond faults with the particular parts or an out-of-memory game crash. And also much less likely to be broken by KSP updates.

Parts add new shapes of things that are already in the game: Fuel tanks, wings, engines etc. Sometimes part mods can include plugins, such as Firespitter for animations.

Plugins add new behaviour: Life support, re-entry heating, extra readouts etc. These mods often have parts included with the plugin.
Do they install differently? (I know some mods are installed completely differently than most the others)
Installation is identical, just copy the appropriate folder to the Gamedata folder.

Installation is identical, just copy the appropriate folder to the Gamedata folder.

Alrighty then, thank you!
